title: Low FPS
body:
Intel i7 6700HQ
GTX 1070
32 GB RAM
Getting major low FPS in all graphics settings

replies.body:
I'm with Cpt Genie, there are a few steps to be taken in order to pinpoint the cause.

1. I'd recommend [rolling back](http://www.nvidia.com/object/driver_rollback.html) your display driver to version **372.90** which you can find [**here.**](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/107564/en-us)

2. I'd recommend you don't have the Windows Game Bar enabled, as it's been causing FPS issues and system freezes since it released. [**This guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) will assist you in disabling this feature in case it was enabled.

Let me know if either of those resolved this issue for you.

1. Wrong driver
2. Didn't update dxdiag
3. CPU overheat or VGA

Drivers are up to date (this is a laptop)
cpu 50C
